1.title: The Devil's Carny
1.plot: In the season three premiere of 'Inside Horror' the hosts debate the best depictions of cinematic Hell and are joined by the creator's of 'Repo: The genetic Opera' and the new Horror musical- 'The Devil's Carnival', Darren Lynn Bousman and Terrance Zdunich.

1.title: Monsters in the Movies
1.plot: Director John Landis discusses his new book 'Monsters in the Movies' and the hosts discuss 'The Devil Inside'.

2.title: The Woman
2.plot: Actress Pollyanna McIntosh joins us to discuss her controversial role in Lucky McKee's 'The Woman' and director Scott Leberecht talks about his indie vampire film 'Midnight Son'. We also have an exclusive field report interview with the preternaturally beautiful Kate Beckinsale on coming back to play Death Dealer Selene in the fourth installment in the Underworld franchise.

3.title: Theatre Bizzarre
3.plot: 'American Grindhouse' director Elijah Drenner spotlights the work of French filmmaker Jean Rollin and we discuss the new Grand Guignol anthology 'The Theatre Bizzarre' with directors David Gregory, Jeremy Kasten and Buddy Giovinazzo.

4.title: The River
4.plot: The director of 'Paranormal Activity' Oren Peli joins us to discuss his new ABC show 'The River' as well as found footage filmmkaing and the 'Paranormal Activity' franchise.

5.title: High Tensions
5.plot: We talk to director Alexandre Aja about his intense survival films, his success with re-makes and how he will re-imagine 'Maniac'. We also spotlight new indie thriller 'Removal' with director Nick Simon and star Mark kelly.

6.title: Bloody Valentines
6.plot: In our bloody Valentines day episode we are joined by power couple Michael Biehn and Jennifer Blanc to discuss their new film 'The Victim' and their experiences on 'The Divide'. We also slip in some William Friedkin and James Cameron stories and visit the set of the new film 'The Devil's Carnival' and talk to Darren Lynn Bousman about his musical follow up to 'Repo:The Genetic opera'.

7.title: Women in Horror
7.plot: Join us as we celebrate Women in Horror month with the creators of the Viscera film festival Shannon Lark and Heidi Honeycutt who discuss the changing landscape of horror for Women filmmakers. We also welcome the only women to have been both the heads and tails of the Human Centipede, actress Ashylynn Yennie.

8.title: Final Girls Finale
8.plot: Join as we celebrate the end of Women in Horror Month in our season finale with Horror icons Sybil Danning and Danielle Harris who discuss the changing role of women in the genre and we are joined by many up and coming Horror actresses and directors who discuss their latest projects.

1.title: The Sequel
1.plot: On the season two premiere of 'Inside Horror' we discuss our favorite horror sequels and review the new films 'Cabin in the Woods' and the 'Wicker Tree'. We introduce the newest member of our team Fangoria's Rebekah McKendry and Joe Dante joins us in studio to discuss the future of Cinema and his career from cutting trailers for Corman to his latest 3D film 'The Hole'.

2.title: Dead Kids Walking
2.plot: This week hosts Elric Kane, Staci Layne Wilson and Fangoria's Rebekah McKendry discuss their favorite Home Invasion films and review the new film 'Mother's Day' and 'The Raven'. Joining them in studio to discuss her latest horror project'The Dark Path Chronicles' is Director Mary Lambert of 'Pet Sematary' fame and all the way from Ireland Director Ciaran Foy joins in to discuss his SXSW award winning personal horror film 'Citadel'.

3.title: Re-Animated
3.plot: This week hosts Elric Kane, Staci Layne Wilson and Fangoria's Rebekah McKendry discuss their favorite Mental Asylum films, review 'Re-Animator the Musical' and the Australian gem 'The Loved Ones'. Joining them in studio to discuss his on going one man Poe show 'Nevermore' is actor Jeffrey Combs of 'Re-Animator' fame who also discusses his upcoming role as a deranged philanthropist in 'Would You Rather?'.

4.title: El Sid!
4.plot: This week hosts Elric Kane and Fangoria's Rebekah McKendry discuss their favorite Monster movies and review the new films 'Dark Shadows' and the Phillipino ghost story 'The Road'. Joining them to discuss his fifty year career in film is the man who made clowns scary again, actor Sid Haig (Captain Spaulding in 'The Devil's Rejects).

5.title: Animal Attacks
5.plot: On this episode Elric, Bekah and I welcomed special guest John Gulager (director of the upcoming wet 'n wild Piranha 3DD), along with one of our regular faves, Elijah Drenner who was on hand to talk about our giveaway of the new Blu-ray edition of Ganja & Hess, an obscure, arty vampire film. First up, we talked about our favorite animal attack films. Elric went with the rats in Food of the Gods; Bekah, a once-budding entomologist, chose Slugs; while I, an equal-opportunity abhorrent-animal aficionado, included the whole darn forest from Day of the Animals. Fun fact: I...

6.title: The Great Debate
6.plot: For the first time, Inside Horror hosted a debate panel and it was a lot of fun... went by super-quick! With three smart, opinionated and well-informed guests, we could have gone on and on. Drew Daywalt ("Master of the Short Shock"), Tammi Sutton (director of Isle of Dogs), and Matthew Currie Holmes (producer, P5Ych), all talked about found footage films, sequels and remakes, plus the proliferation of so-called DIY filmmaking.

7.title: A Haunting We Will Go
7.plot: Inside Horror welcomes director Ti West (The Innkeepers, House of the Devil)to discuss his unique approach to genre filmmaking and how he built suspense in 'the Innkeepers' also the hosts discuss their favorite cinematic Hauntings.

8.title: Mistress of the Dark
8.plot: Welcome to the season 2 finale of Inside Horror! Where we welcomed the lovely, vivacious and always candid Cassandra Peterson, best-known as Elvira, Mistress of the Dark. We asked her about everything from her life-changing experiences with Elvis Presley, to working with Fellini on Roma, to crazy fan experiences, and even the house she once lived in which is haunted by not one or two, but three ghosts!
